intro: Monotagma breviscapum, commonly known as the short-horned bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while the stems are erect and somewhat hairy. Monotagma breviscapum is often found in fynbos vegetation and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region.
